result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Jaquiese Glenn

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Zachary Jaquiese Glenn.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is currently unavailable; military leave. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Sarah Zwach not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel contacted the court off the record and reported a scheduling conflict. Requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Correspondence with parties. Although this case was originally calendared for a State V Lee Hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Court thereby vacates 09/28/2022 hearing date, and re-calendars case for a Preliminary Hearing on 09/16/2022 at 8:30 am before Prelim Court.
Received and Filed. STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER - ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL

Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court for Zachary Jaquiese Glenn.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State v Lee Hearing. Attorney Reed provides an update to the court. Court finds cause to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned for an additional State v Lee Hearing to Br 16.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminray hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Zachary Jaquiese Glenn in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zachary Jaquiese Glenn appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
